reviewText: This was a wonderful movie. It is definitely one I would recommend for families. I appreciate movies that don't encourage the use of vulgarity. I will watch it again and again alone and with friends, that's how much I like it.
Title: A Horse for Danny

reviewText: This is a great movie and good for the whole family.  Danny was quite a little buisness woman.  And won in the end.  Really enjoyed it!
Title: A Horse for Danny

reviewText: I bought this movie for my wife who loves horses.  It was a good movie.
Title: A Horse for Danny

reviewText: My middle daughter discovered this movie on TV when she was a kid and we watched it together. We also rented it "back in the day" when you had to go to the store to rent VHS tapes. Can't even tell you how many times we watched it! I surprised her with the dvd for Christmas this year and, at the "ripe old age" of 29, she was thrilled beyond belief to receive it! It's still a wonderful film and if you have a horse crazy girl in your family, buy her this movie!!
Title: A Horse for Danny

reviewText: Not a bad little horse piece, and pretty safe for children (as long as you don't object to a few gambling themes).This was a fairly low-budget movie, so there are no slick special effects. Horse movies shouldn't need them, either! There are still some lovely shots of Thoroughbreds doing what they do best: run their hearts out. Horse lovers (and racing lovers) will think this is great; the general public might not. Those who like this movie will keep liking it and those who hate it probably won't change their minds. The cinematography is straightforward and will look dated by now, but this isn't a deal-breaker for me. The scripting isn't awful, but not especially edgy or clever (in other words, rather "middle ground" among horse films). The music is pleasant, though a bit repetitive (again, probably due to the modest budget). As a child, I personally thought the plotting in this movie was actually pretty original and a somewhat gentle way to give children insights about the dark side of the glittering world of horse racing (without actually getting horrendously bleak - after all, it has a perfectly happy ending). Someone else will always disagree, though. People need to remember two things when considering movies: the intended audience (children's movies are seldom done in the same style as non-children's movies) and the filming techniques of the time when the movie was made (in this case, 1995 will be quite foreign to those who weren't yet alive or those who are expecting every movie in the world to be thrill-a-minute action/horror/mystery).I've always thought that Leelee Sobieski has a very distinctive appearance and acting method, and this was clear even in this 1995 work. Considering she was only about 12 when this movie was made, she's not bad (many people think her first screen appearance was in "Jungle 2 Jungle," "Deep Impact," or the "Joan of Arc" miniseries, but that's simply not true). Minor flaws in the dialogue (hollow lines) are the problem of the scripting, not the actors.In general, I have no particular opinion about Robert Urich (I'm merely unfamiliar with him), but he's a strong casting choice in this case and is a good way to tie the rest of the cast together.
summary: Sweet horse movie, early Leelee Sobieski work, pretty safe for kids
Title: A Horse for Danny

reviewText: I thought this DVD was very good, especially if you are a horse fan. It took a young girl blessed with knowledge for horses and goes to show how far adults will go to intimidate a little girl, and cheat in the sport of horse racing in order to ruin the sport. The DVD was recommended to me by my Mom, who has taught me most everything I know about horses.A Horse for Danny
Title: A Horse for Danny

reviewText: We first learned about this movie because a couple at church loaned it to us.  After seeing it, we knew we had to own it because it is a great family movie that the children love and enjoy over and over.  It's hard to find clean, family shows, so I was so happy to find this one.
summary: great movie for the whole family
Title: A Horse for Danny

reviewText: Not impressed, bought for my granddaughter. I also bought Flicka, my granddaughter was very impressed with that movie.
Title: A Horse for Danny
